name: kicad
issues_template:
<!-- --------Before Creating a New Issue-----------
* Limit report to a single issue.
* Search the issue tracker to verify the issue has not already been reported.
* Complete all instructions between `template comment markers <>.
* Keep report contents limited to the necessary information required to fix the issue.
* When creating an issue against the stable version of KiCad, make sure the latest available stable version is installed as issues may have already been resolved in later stable versions. -->
# Description
<!-- What is the current behavior and what is the expected behavior?  -->
<!-- If the issue is visual/graphical, please attach screenshots of the problem. -->
<!--  Add the issue details below this line and before the "Steps to reproduce" heading. -->

# Steps to reproduce
<!-- If there are multiple steps to reproduce it or it is a visual issue, then providing a screen recording as an attachment to this report is recommended. -->
<!-- If this issue is specific to a project, please attach the necessary files to this issue. -->
<!--  Add the steps to reproduce using the numbers below -->
<!--  Add new step numbers before the "KiCad Version" heading. -->
1.
2.

# KiCad Version
<!-- Copy version information (from main menu Help->About KiCad ->Copy Version Info) and paste it between the triple backticks below to preserve the formatting. -->
```
```
merge_requests_template:
<!-- --------ATTENTION HACKTOBERFEST PARTICIPANTS:
KiCad does NOT participate in Hacktoberfest.  We welcome your participation in our
community year-round but this will not earn you a Hacktoberfest T-shirt. If you would like to help improve
KiCad, please look at https://gitlab.com/kicad/code/kicad/-/issues?scope=all&state=opened&label_name[]=starter
for a list of issues that are considered good for starting out hacking on KiCad. -->

<!-- --------Before Creating a New Merge Request-----------
# Required Settings:
Please configure your personal fork of the KiCad project with the following settings:
1. Settings->General->Visibility->CI/CD should be enabled and set to "Everyone with access".
2. Settings->CI/CD->General Pipelines timeout should be set to >3h .
3. The "Allow commits from members who can merge to the target branch." option check box at the bottom of your merge request must be checked.

#General Guidelines:
1. Do not submit a merge request against the master branch of your fork.  Always create a new branch for merge requests.
2. Make sure your code submission follows the [KiCad Coding Style Policy](Documentation/development/coding-style-policy.md).
3. Make sure all User Interface changes follow the [User Interface Guidelines](Documentation/development/ui-policy.md).
4. Give merge requests a short and descriptive title that summarizes the major changes it contains (not just an issue number). A longer description of the changes should be contained inside the description of the merge request.
---------Add your merge request details below----------- -->
